channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NJ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NJ

item.title: Report X-2024071316
item.description:
Report X-2024071316

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-22T18:15:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-16
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: One (1) of the gallon content was spilled in total which left three (3) to be disposed of. they were placed in a lined salvage drum. As previously stated, there were damages to the fiberboard box in which they were contained. There were no other damages reported.

item.title: Report E-2024070392
item.description:
Report E-2024070392

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-12
  • City: NEWARK
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 12, 2024, twelve (12) 5-gallon pails of UN3149 were punctured and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. Two (2) 55-gallon drums of waste were staged onsite for disposal.

item.description:

  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package arrived at hazmat during sunrise sort. inspection showed package to be wet with internal leakage, torn open, and 1 of 4 items with a loose cap. Damage most likely from being placed on wrong conveyor belt. Remaining contents will be returned to shipper, unless otherwise stated.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported 3 gallons of a UN 1263 "RUDCO Passionate Purple" released from 3-5 gallon metal pails due to improper loading, impacting the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS and the caller determined terminal personnel are capable of conducting clean up with the available PPE on-site.

item.title: Report X-2024070987
item.description:
Report X-2024070987

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-17T18:15:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-11
  • City: BARRINGTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DURING THE UNLOAD THE MANAGER NOTICED THAT THE METAL PAIL HAD A DENT BASICALLY ON THE TOP EDGE WHICH WAS CAUSING LIQUID TO LEAK FROM THE PAIL. MANAGER IMMEDIATELY TOOK THE PAIL TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT PROPERLY. I WAS THEN CALLED OVER TO REPACK IT INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM IN A TIMELY AND SAFE MANNER. APPROXIMATELY 1 LITER LEAKED FROM THE TOP CLOSURE DUE TO A DENT AND PUNCTURE AT THE TOP. WAITING FOR THE DISPOSITION FROM PGH NOW.

Report X-2024070981
